definition: A living organism that inhabits the vast bodies of water on our planet, including oceans, seas, and other aquatic environments. It encompasses a wide range of species, from microscopic organisms to large marine animals. This term is commonly employed in scientific and ecological contexts to discuss the diverse and interconnected web of life found in marine ecosystems.

examples.english: The marine organism swims in the ocean.

examples.german: Meereslebewesen sind an das Leben im Wasser angepasst.
examples.english: Marine organisms are adapted to life in water.
Some marine organisms glow in the dark.

examples.german: Die Vielfalt der Meereslebewesen ist beeindruckend.
examples.english: The diversity of marine organisms is impressive.

examples.german: Meereslebewesen spielen eine wichtige Rolle im Ã–kosystem.
examples.english: Marine organisms play an important role in the ecosystem.
